data.title: Great food!
data.text: This is more of an authentic Mexican fast food establishment. We tried it for the lunch the other day and I love the salsa bar. If they had a hot sauce bar it would be even better. The burrito's were very large and tasted amazing.

data.title: Good
data.text: Taco Villa never disappoints. You know what to expect. Combination burrito and bean burrito was very good.  Sopapillas are excellent. Fast and friendly. Hot sauce bar fresh and plentiful. Reasonable prices.

data.title: sorry I have not eaten there lately
data.text: I actually chose this one by mistake have not eaten there in a while, but it would not let me out of the review. the last time I was there it was good.

data.title: yum
data.text: Just had to stop and get my favorite burrito there. Did not disappoint me at all. It was just right along with the hot sauce at sauce table. Amarillo Boulevard and N Grant. Very quick and friendly service.

data.title: Clean, friendly, good food
data.text: I have been in Amarillo nearly 3 months, and finally tried one of these fast food Mexican places- i would recommend them for good ice tea, super friendly and fast staff.  I had two hard shell tacos with sour cream: shells were fresh and crunchy, meat was good, maybe a tad bland, but overall it's a good place if your in a hurry and on a budget.  Two thumbs up on the staff for sure!

data.title: Shining Star in Culinary Wasteland.
data.text: Okay,having never heard of this chain, had to give it a try. Spotlessly clean exerior, a speaker system that works and a line of cars coninually moving, good things might be in store. A relatively large menu for such a small place, I opted for bean tostada and crunchy beef taco. Neither disappointed. The tostada was warm and crispy, slathered in a rich refried bean mixture that gave a nice contrast to the crunch of the corn tortilla. A required layer of shredded iceberg, and the most cheese I can recall seeing.The taco meat was moist, flavorful hot, just great. Again the required toppings, heavy on lactose! You are asked at the speaker if you want hot sauce, and they is a little in your bag if you answer yes. Not store made, no chunks, a non-descript red sauce that leaves one looking for the "hot". This is fast food at its finest, if such a thing exists. If you are wanting "Mexican" food, not really cooked but prepared and topped, lightening fast frendly service stop by. They don't disappoint.

data.title: Taco Villa is a "must stop" when we travel through Amarillo
data.text: We love Taco Villa, and wish it were available in more places.  When we travel through Amarillo, we always stop, whether it is meal time or not.  We have tried almost everything on the menu and have liked it all.  In addition, the staff is friendly and the facility is spotlessly clean.  If you want fast food Mexican, then be sure to try Taco Villa.

data.title: It's good fast food, but...
data.text: It's good fast food, but a little pricey. Way better than Taco Bell for sure.
